hasDitaContent.@value: Both rasagiline and sumatriptan can increase the risk of serotonin syndrome. See 'Serotonin syndrome' and 'Monoamine-oxidase inhibitor' under Antidepressant drugs in BNF for more information and for specific advice on avoiding monoamine-oxidase inhibitors during and after administration of other serotonergic drugs.

hasMessage.hasTextContent: Both  rasagiline  and  sumatriptan  can increase the risk of serotonin syndrome. See 'Serotonin syndrome' and 'Monoamine-oxidase inhibitor' under Antidepressant drugs in BNF for more information and for specific advice on avoiding monoamine-oxidase inhibitors during and after administration of other serotonergic drugs.

hasDitaContent.@value: Tapentadol is predicted to increase the risk of serotonin syndrome when given with rasagiline. Manufacturer advises caution.

hasMessage.hasTextContent: Tapentadol   is predicted to   increase   the risk of serotonin syndrome when given with   rasagiline .  Manufacturer advises caution .

hasDitaContent.@value: Rasagiline is predicted to increase the risk of severe hypertension when given with terbutaline. Manufacturer advises avoid.

hasMessage.hasTextContent: Rasagiline   is predicted to   increase   the risk of severe hypertension when given with   terbutaline .  Manufacturer advises avoid .

hasDitaContent.@value: Tetrabenazine potentially increases the risk of CNS excitation and hypertension when given with rasagiline. Manufacturer makes no recommendation.

hasMessage.hasTextContent: Tetrabenazine   potentially   increases   the risk of CNS excitation and hypertension when given with   rasagiline .  Manufacturer makes no recommendation .
